If yes, describe these: Stairs on sides of floors on first floor. Third floor East side accessible only by stairwells.
If yes, describe: Braille for classroom signs. Braille signs are sometimes too high to comfortably reach in a wheelchair.
Comments and additional information: Accessible water fountain on third floor, second floor, first floor. Trash can blocking entrance to 301. Heavy door to stairwells on West side of building. Difficult to access meditation space and bathrooms on East side of second floor.

If yes, describe: Braille signs outside of every classroom or lecture hall
Chemicals and allergens?: Often there are chemical smells from dental lab work

If yes, describe these: Second floor (Political Science department offices) not accessible by elevator. All but one entrance inaccessible. Basement restrooms inaccessible by elevator and require PennCard.
Comments and additional information: Accessible restroom only accessible by pin code that only building administrator knows.

If yes, describe these: Some of the lecture halls do not have accessible seating
If yes, describe: Some of the classrooms have Braille signage most do not
Describe the lighting: Ground floor and basement are not well lit. Relies on natural lighting which is not always good.

If yes, describe these: Departmental offices on each floor are behind a heavy door that does not have a push plate and may be less than 32" wide.
If yes, describe: Signage available but our of reach for a wheelchair user
Comments and additional information: Accessible water fountains are located on each floor next to the bathrooms.

If yes, describe these: The entrance to Harrison Auditorium is closed for renovation. The Trescher entrance to the museum is usually locked but the courtyard is accessible.
Comments and additional information: There is a ramp on the west side of the building to the Kamin entrance.  There are automatic doors at the Kress entrance.

If yes, describe these: Floor 2 (card access required) ; Floor 3R (card access required) ; Floor 4(card access required) ; Floor 4B(card access required); Roof
Comments and additional information: Gendered bathrooms on LLR, accessible but automatic door doesn't work; Stacks narrow; inaccessible 2nd floor study area; emergency exits only accessible by stairs; elevators in certain spaces only accessible with clearance
Lactation space on ground floor. Accessible, gender-neutral bathroom in basement. Floors 4 and above are department floors which are difficult for unaffiliated people to access.

If yes, describe: Elevators stairs and rooms have Braille signage.
Describe the lighting: Lighting is a mixture. Atrium spaces are well lit with natural light. Lots of corridors which are darker and lit by artificial light.
Chemicals and allergens?: Little bit of a sterilised smell.
Comments and additional information: No obviously inaccessible spaces but lots of doors particularly on floors 2, 3 and 4 are heavy and hard to open

Building name: Annenberg Center for the Performing arts
If yes, describe these: Building has a number of steps, and a few areas surrounded by steps such as the 37th street entrance. Other locations such as the theaters can be reached by elevator on request.
If yes, describe: The bathrooms have Braille signs however they are at standing eye level. Other doors do not seem to have
Describe the lighting: Mostly overhead florescent lights, both in lobby area and hallways
Comments and additional information: All floors of building can be accessed by elevator, and on nights of their shows the staff have ushers to help patrons out. Third floor hallway is a little narrow but accommodating. Most of building is carpeted.

If yes, describe these: Some smaller doorways in classrooms and 3rd floor
Restrooms NOT on floors 2,3,5 are not wheelchair accessible. seating area between the third and fourth floor landing is not wheelchair accessible. Stair access only.
If yes, describe: Signs state room number and department name (when applicable). Restrooms do not have Braille signage.
Chemicals and allergens?: Strong coffee aroma in the area of Williams Cafe on the entrance floor.
Comments and additional information: Bathroom on 5th floor- best one:  Door opening button.  Braille signs.  Wheelchair accessible   Bathroom on Ground, 2nd, 3rd floor:  No door opening button.  Accessible stalls.

Floor 1: 4 gender-neutral bathrooms. Floor 2: no public restrooms. Floor 3: inaccessible (stairs at back). Floor 1R: non-accessible front door (no automatic door); ramp to Palestra. Basement: no public restrooms. Floor

If yes, describe these: The roof. Telephone closet on 5th floor.
Describe the lighting: Fluorescent lights, few windows. Natural lighting in central atrium from 2nd floor up
Comments and additional information: Narrow hallways and doors. No accessible bathrooms above 1st floor; lactation space on 2nd floor requires code; on campus recruiting is accessible

no bathrooms on first floor, nonworking standard height pushplate at main entrance, use ankle height. perelman quad entrance not usable. No Braille signage. wheelchair accessible water fountain on B2 and G.
Tampon machine in women’s restroom which is too high to reach. Ground floor bathrooms have wash basins difficult to reach. Emergency exit on second floor is accessible only by stairs.

Describe the lighting: Big windows with plenty of artificial lighting

If yes, describe these: South basement double doors without push pad and too narrow (rooms B12-B13, integrated product design studio). Office of diversity and inclusion accessible only by inaccessible double doors, room 125. Computer lab only accessible by freight elevator.
If yes, describe: Likely too high for some wheelchair users.
Comments and additional information: Gender neutral bathrooms in basement are marked by gender but are single user bathrooms, both have changing tables. No elevators in building but elevators in connected Skirkanich Hall and Levine Hall.
Bathrooms do not have automatic doors

If yes, describe: Sometimes difficult to feel, usually too high for wheelchair users.
Comments and additional information: North elevator accesses more floors and Moore building. Building connected to Moore, Levine, and Towne halls on 1, 2, 3.

If yes, describe these: Ground floor is not for the most part
If yes, describe: Very rarely, central common use rooms, not offices.
Describe the lighting: Old, no natural light, fluorescent, dim
Chemicals and allergens?: Strong chemical smell, smells of old books and plastic
Comments and additional information: Elevator says which floor you’re going. The exit signs don’t point towards exits, very misleading, ground floor has no accessible fire exit, ground floor leads to parking garage of Caster

If yes, describe these: The entire fourth floor is inaccessible. This is the location of the Philomathean society, and all of the rooms used by this society are inaccessible to wheelchair users. While every other floor is accessible by elevator, the elevator is very narrow.
If yes, describe: Braille on all signs but often too high for wheelchair users.
Describe the lighting: The lighting is mostly soft interior lights. The second and third floors are particularly dark. Some rooms have big windows with natural light.
Chemicals and allergens?: Not particularly. Some dust and lots of plants.
Comments and additional information: Signage is often too high for wheelchair users. Many of the doors are very heavy. Some bathrooms labelled accessible are not well designed. Particularly the accessible bathroom on the second and third floors have no push button and is poorly designed.
